entry.title: [ThumbnailCapturerMac] Improve memory handling
entry.content:
Improve the memory handling in ThumbnailCapturerMac by consistently

wrapping Core Graphics objects in a ScopedCFTypeRef<>.



This fixes one memory leak and improves the overall readability.

entry.title: [DL] Ensure grid placement data is dirty.
entry.content:
After:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4859555



We started to return nullptr from NGBlockNode::FirstChild. This works

but grid has an additional placement cache which depends on if we

have a first child or not.



Invalidate the placement cache when the display lock context marks

a node for layout.

entry.title: Revert "Always attempt video decoder init if we don't have fallback."
entry.content:
This reverts commit f5be305cce08118a4983ac2fa7441ff30eca8aad.



Reason for revert: breaks tests on win-asan bot.



Bug: chromium:1484552



Original change's description:

> Always attempt video decoder init if we don't have fallback.

>

> For codecs such as H264, H265 we may not have software fallback

> depending on the platform. As such even if OS metadata suggests

> the playback will fail, try it anyways because it certainly will

> otherwise.

>

> This is useful since the OS metadata doesn't always appear accurate

> on Android and may be too expensive to compute accurately on other

> platforms (e.g., requires testing resolutions one at a time).

>

> Fixed: 1473863

> Change-Id: I7153419a85805433ac541bb6fa1037ad93d1789e

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4852628

> Reviewed-by: Dan Sanders

> Commit-Queue: Dale Curtis

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1198159}

entry.title: Create a detached tab on the same display as original window.
entry.content:
* Intrduce display_id parameter in Browser::CreateParams/Widget::InitParams

* Add display parameter to

WindowParentingClient::GetDefaultParent

as a hint to prefer the specified display even if the bounds is

mostly outside of the display.

* Update WindowParentingController to honor the display (root window)

Fallback if the window will be off screen.

* Do not use saved bounds for detached tab.

* Support the output parameter in set_window_bounds request.

I changed lacros size not to send the output unless the target

display id is specified to keep the same behavior as ToT.



Bug: 1455178

Test: TBD.

entry.title: [iOS][Toolbar] Use keyboardLayoutGuide in secondaryToolbarView
entry.content:
- Use UIKeyboardLayoutGuide for constraining SecondaryToolbarView above

the keyboard instead of computing the height manually.

- When SecondaryToolbarView is above the keyboard, lower the height

constraint to UILayoutPriorityDefaultHigh. This is needed for

UIKeyboardLayoutGuide to take over.

- When SecondaryToolbarView leaves the keyboard, reset to required

priority, as UIKeyboardLayoutGuide forces the view to be above the

bottom safe area, even when the constraint is disabled.



Recording: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Jnv7lJOekjEaiZVatctGzxaqXmkob1Xc/view?usp=drive_link

entry.title: [AWC] Make `resizable` CSS media query return an actual value
entry.content:
This CL passes the value from `WidgetDelegate::CanResize` down to

`MediaValues`. Previously `resizable` was always returning true, because

the actual value was not passed.



This CL still lacks the implementation to observe the changes on the

`CanResize` and the value is only updated "lazily" due to other changes.

Observing the changes and proper updates to the value are implemented in

a follow-up CL (crrev.com/c/4854031).



I2P thread

https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/oCxWg8q_OQY/m/LUTw0T5cCQAJ



Public explainer is available @

https://github.com/ivansandrk/additional-windowing-controls/blob/main/awc-explainer.md



Private doc @ go/additional-windowing-controls



Bug: 1466855, b:288265319

entry.title: [sync] Add field in SyncablePrefsMetadata for pref merge behavior
entry.content:
This CL introduces a new field in SyncablePrefsMetadata to specify the

merge behavior for each syncable preference.



Currently there exist methods in PrefModelAssociatorClient which help

check whether a pref is mergeable or not but they are not convenient to

use. The syncable prefs database would later be the source of truth for

this info.

entry.title: [iOS] Add IsSupported() to PhotosService
entry.content:
This CL adds a IsSupported() method to PhotosService. The IsAvailable()

method already returns if the service can be used to perform operations

NOW e.g. upload an image. However, another method is needed to determine

whether the service is at all supported i.e. whether the service can be

used to perform operations at some point in the future.



This will be used to determine whether Save to Photos settings can be

shown in Settings, which should be the case even if the service is not

"available" e.g. an operation is already ongoing but should not happen

if the service is not "supported".

entry.title: Implement modular MovingWindow to replace MovingAverage/Max classes
entry.content:
Heavy use of templates metaprogramming ensures that unused features don't invoke any memory or processing penalty.



User can select which features they need in list of template parameters. Implemented features are:

- Min

- Max

- Mean

- Variance

- Iterate through the window



This class incorporates ui/base/moving_max class.



Also, use this class instead of media/base/moving_average.h for Max and Min calculation already.



Follow-up CL will remove existing base/power_monitor/moving_average.h and media/base/moving_average.h



Temporary unit-tests are also added to ensure that the new class behaves exactly as old ones and it's safe to replace them.

entry.title: [cc] Simplify and adjust memory limits on Android
entry.content:
On Android, compositor memory limits are derived from system memory and

dalvik memory limits. This code was noted as outdated in 2017 (see

linked bug), and as a result didn't work the way it should have.



This is because:

- Reported system RAM on Android is lower than installed RAM because of

carveouts

- Dalvik memory limits are not really correlated with system RAM



Based on field data, the large majority of devices is running with a

computed limit of 256MiB, with some devices using 96MiB. This CL

simplifies the code to:

- Low-end or <2GiB: 96MiB

- Otherwise, 256MiB



Which mostly matches the current in-the-wild reality. These limits are

likely not optimal, but at least this simplifies the code. Also, lower

the priority cutoff to "NICE_TO_HAVE", which matches desktop, and

reality, since ALLOW_EVERYTHING is lowered to NICE_TO_HAVE elsewhere in

the code (see PriorityCutoffToTileMemoryLimitPolicy() for instance).



This is gated behind a feature flag, to make sure that this is not

breaking things.



Bug: 742534

Change-Id: Ie9525f4a18a6a7057a5e39734f50db3a7ccd0fd9

entry.title: base: make the process dumpable before opening /proc/self/mem
entry.content:
It is possible that the process has been set to not-dumpable. In this

case, opening /proc/self/mem is forbidden. Adding a ScopedPrSetDumpable

object ensures we're trying to switch this flag until the file is open.



This feature was taken from

third_party/crashpad/crashpad/util/linux/scoped_pr_set_dumpable.{h,cc}



In case the process is already dumpable, this is just a no-op.

entry.title: [SHv2] Small fixes for password check module
entry.content:
This CL fixes two issues:

(1) When a password had multiple issues, e.g. both weak and reused, only one was counted because the counting logic stopped early. Now all issues

are tracked.

(2) To determine the next password check time, a fixed constant was added to the last time. However when the time for the last password

check was a long time ago, the next run was also in the past. Now the

interval is added until the next check is in the future.

creating the headerImageView in PromoStyleViewController, when its

image or a11y label setter is called but the view is not created yet.

In this case, those info should be stored and applied to the

entry.title: [Autofill] Weaken IsOwnedByFrame() DCHECK
entry.content:
Form elements can specify a `target` for the form submission, which

can lead to form submission events in frames where Autofill doesn't

know that form.



For example, consider the following form and iframe of origin

"https://foobar.com":

...




Autofill cannot handle these form submissions because it doesn't

know the submitted form in the frame `x`. (This is probably fixable

in most cases since AutofillAcrossIframes.) Therefore, Autofill

currently ignores such form submissions. The code to ignore these

form submissions is in FormTracker::WillSubmitForm().



In this context, we added DCHECKs in many AutofillAgent events that

assert that the form belongs to the AutofillAgent's frame. The

purpose of these DCHECKs is to discover similar cases where a form

somehow ends up in the "wrong" frame.



These DCHECKs sometimes fail when the form's frame has been deleted

in the meantime. This CL therefore weakens the DCHECK accordingly.



Alternatively, we could have converted the DCHECKs to early returns,

but that would defeat the point of the DCHECKs to notify us of

unexpected forms.



Another idea was to compare the form's document, rather than the

frame. But these DCHECKs would fail when the event happens after a

navigation (e.g., due to throttling). We could cancel timers when

a new WebDocument is created to address this. But that feels like a

risky change.



Bug: 1475098

Change-Id: If19e4dfad617664c39a9f3b5b2a94de0b71a53fb

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4863903

Reviewed-by: Dominic Battre

entry.title: Fix dangling ptr on shutdown in WithSharedWebContentsResources
entry.content:
In a recent CL [1] the web contents manager prepares the shared web

contents for loading before the command starts. This required

the `start_command` callback (which implicitly captures the lock and

therefore a `raw_ref` to the shared web contents; captured to the

callback in `WebAppLockManager::AcquireLock`) to be moved to the URL

loader.



The preparation, done in the `WebAppUrlLoader::PrepareForLoad`

function, posts a loader task in `WebAppUrlLoader::LoadUrlInternal`.

If the system shuts down at this point, this will lead to a dangling

pointer in `WithSharedWebContentsResources`. This was discovered

by porting an existing test the externally managed app refactoring

[2].



[1] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4825046

[2] https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/linux-rel/b8769589932351133825/test-results?q=ExactID%3Aninja%3A%2F%2Fchrome%2Ftest%3Abrowser_tests%2FExternallyManagedAppManagerBrowserTest.ShutdownWithPendingInstallation+VHash%3Ac7218831f14d758b&clean=&sortby=&groupby=



Change-Id: I4ec61602abf4cbfaad9392982a4fa17265ada717

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4875373

Reviewed-by: Alan Cutter

Commit-Queue: Simon Hangl

entry.title: [OOBE] Fix Crash ScreenManager::GetScreen<ash::DrivePinningScreen>
entry.content:
when the wizard_controller is initialized it starts off with a different

profile from the user profile. The `IsOobeDrivePinningEnabled()` returns

false at this point and doesn't include the DrivePinningScreen to

screen_manager. Later on when the user has passed the login screen and

is at the consent screen, the `IsOobeDrivePinningEnabled()` returns true

and tries to get the DrivePinningScreen to kick off CalculateRequiredSpace

but it was never added due to the first false call.Use Same condition

IsOobeDrivePinningEnabled() when initialize handler.

do not include kFeatureManagementDriveFsBulkPinning in the check

IsOobeDrivePinningEnabled as there is an exception for googler users.



Bug: b:299078820 , b:300615576

GMB. If they actually occur in practice, the code should treat them as

error cases and short-circuit out as it already does if GMBManager

fails to return a GMB on creation. This CL changes them to CHECKs so

entry.title: Setup custom messaging for file transfer connector
entry.content:
This CL enables the possibility of retrieving custom dialog properties from a file transfer delegate.

Because a file transfer delegate can manage multiple files each one with its onw result tag (dlp, malware),

we dropped the relationship with the base class ContentAnalysisDelegateBase to specify getter methods

taking an input tag.

In addition, the CL sets up these custom dialog properties for the warning scenario. A subsequent CL will

take care of setting them up for the error scenario.

entry.title: PageLoadMetrics: Use base::Uma* instead of macros from histogram_macros
entry.content:
PageLoadMetrics historically has used histogram_macros in the most

places, but as guideline recommends using histogram_functions, this

patch experimentally replaces the existing macros in the common place

with the function versions. This also replace other macro calls

that failed to compile as of missing header inclusion caused by the

core change. So, still there are macro call sites that include the

histogram_macros.h by hand.



This change expects binary size reduction, but potentially may cause

a performance regression. So, let's try and see how perf tests think.



Dryrun says this change can reduce Android binary size by 10KB.



Bug: n/a

Change-Id: I4aa932aae740a4d5699eb2e5fca625e82f2be99f

entry.title: Cleanup ResourceRequestSender.
entry.content:
This CL removes ResourceRequestSender.should_follow_redirect and

PostTask() logic in ResourceRequestSender::OnReceivedRedirect().



`should_follow_redirect` was introduced by crrev.com/c/1007625. It was

set to false when handling a navigation request. But this logic was

removed by crrev.com/c/2115459. So `should_follow_redirect` is always

true after that.



The PostTask() logic in ResourceRequestSender::OnReceivedRedirect() was

introduced by crrev.com/c/1159821 to handle synchronous

OnReceiveRedirect() call in ThrottlingURLLoader::StartNow(). But after

crrev.com/c/2011221, ThrottlingURLLoader::StartNow() asynchronously

calls OnReceiveRedirect() using PostTask(). So we don't need the

PostTask() logic in ResourceRequestSender::OnReceivedRedirect().



Bug: 1379780

Change-Id: I87953a1754a64c8429e3d0db5b0383ce93ac7a29

entry.title: LCPP: Factor out the logic to update LCP string frequency stat data.
entry.content:
For ease of reusing the algorithm, let me factor out the logic outside

of the `RecordSingleLcpInfluencerScriptUrlHistogram`.

The fields in the structure has already been renamed to something

general names.



I plan to send a series of CLs for this refactoring.

1. factor out the update logic.

2. factor out the logic to convert from/to the protobuf struct.

3. merge LcpElementLocatorStat to this.



I believe Chromium uses the binary representation protocol buffer,

and changing the human readable name does not bring any breakage there.

entry.title: CCA: Release the shutter when take photo failed
entry.content:
CCA use a private api to release the shutter. If VCD gets a shutter

notification, CCA will release the shutter. However, when taking photos

fails, we also need to release CCA's shutter. This CL releases CCA's

shutter when VCD gets error notification and takePhoto callback is not

null in the corresponding pending result.

CL.

entry.title: [fetch-later] Add more mojo guards, and set a TTL on loader
entry.content:
FetchLater is a new API still behind a flag.



This CL extracts partial logic from https://crrev.com/c/4803083

to make it simpler:



1. Add more guards in KeepAliveURLLoaderService to reject

potential invalid requests.

2. Move the calling `KeepAliveURLLoader::Start()` of a deferred

loader ino the loader itself.

3. For every loader, enforce a max timeout (30s) after they are

disconnected from renderer, which is the same as pre-keepalive

migration TTL.



Bug: 1465781

entry.title: Reland "Make the Reading mode side panel a local side panel instead of a global one."
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit d5dacbd5bc28d84bbe948719c9f47e91465502ac



The original CL was reverted because it failed linux-chromeos-chrome. In

that failed builder, read_anything_toolbar_view_browsertest crashed

unexpected when initializing a ReadAnythingCoordinator in the

SetUpOnMainThread method (line 62). The crash happened in the

ReadAnythingCoordinator constructor when it called

CreateAndRegisterEntriesForExistingWebContents, a new method I added to

register existing web contents (tabs) to Read Anything Side panel (line

58 in read_anything_coordinator.cc in the original CL). In my update, I

removed this line as well as the

CreateAndRegisterEntriesForExistingWebContents method. This method is

unnecessary because an existing tab will be registered to Read Anything

side panel whenever we switch to that tab in

ReadAnythingCoordinator::OnTabStripModelChanged. After this change,

linux-chromeos-chrome passed and the Read Anything local side panel

still worked correctly.



Original change's description:

> Make the Reading mode side panel a local side panel instead of a global

> one.

>

> Bug: 1439905

> Change-Id: Icdcabd2ddade61c4a32805c9a41668d621993aef

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4756472

> Reviewed-by: Scott Violet

> Reviewed-by: Jocelyn Tran

> Commit-Queue: Xiang Xiao

> Reviewed-by: David Tseng

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1186669}



Bug: 1439905

entry.title: Move rootId back to Tab from CriticalPersistedTabData
entry.content:
rootId is moved back to Tab from CriticalPersistedTabData,

reversing the usage of the UserData pattern. This is part of

CriticalPersistedTabData deprecation.

is replaced with a placeholder value in the persistence parts

of CriticalPersistedTabData. This is safe to do since the experiment

is off. This code will also be removed as part of

this CL to keep CLs focused and tractable.

entry.title: Always attempt video decoder init if we don't have fallback.
entry.content:
For codecs such as H264, H265 we may not have software fallback

depending on the platform. As such even if OS metadata suggests

the playback will fail, try it anyways because it certainly will

otherwise.



This is useful since the OS metadata doesn't always appear accurate

on Android and may be too expensive to compute accurately on other

platforms (e.g., requires testing resolutions one at a time).



Fixed: 1473863

entry.title: List test/data/ subdirectories for components_unittests
entry.content:
It turns out that by moving a large amount of test data into

components/test/data, the amount of data pushed to Android devices for

content_unittests rose significantly. With this change, we list the

subdirectories explicitly, allowing us to pick and choose which are

actually included for these tests.



This excludes components/test/data/viz. For context, see comments

on crrev.com/c/4296397



credit: thanks to ender@ for flagging this issue and to agrieve@

for pointing out that I'd missed trailing slashes.

entry.title: WebNN: Let command recorder keep command resources alive
entry.content:
This CL intends to fix the buffer leak issue discussed in `ComputeImpl`

CL review [1]. The issue is that the caller, e.g.,

`UploadAndCreateBufferBinding`, may call `ReferenceUntilCompleted()` on

the command queue for buffers it creates during the command recording.

If it fails later, the command queue holds onto those buffers. If there

are no new commands submitted and executed by command queue, these

buffers are leaked.



This CL changes `CommandRecorder` to let it keep the resources used by

recorded commands before submission. Only after the commands submission

succeeds in the `CloseAndExecute()` method, these resources will be

transferred to the command queue who will keep them alive until the GPU

work has been completed. If the command recording fails, the caller

should delete the command recorder that will release the resources.



[1]: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4792904/comment/cb1b6faf_317a0009/



Bug: 1273291

Change-Id: I8d7cddaf22e96c249d45c3a100e351b35075cf4a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4863792

Reviewed-by: Rafael Cintron

Commit-Queue: ningxin hu

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1198138}

entry.title: Fix :has() invalidation bug when removing anchor element's siblings
entry.content:
This CL fixes a :has() invalidation bug when the following conditions

are met:



1. A style rule uses a :has() pseudo class. The :has() test result is

affected by the anchor element's relationship to its sibling

element at fixed distance. (e.g. '.a:has(+ .b) {}')

2. The :has() pseudo class was tested on an anchor element and it

didn't matched.

3. If a sibling of the anchor element is removed, the :has() will

match the anchor element.

(e.g. '
')

4. Remove a sibling of the anchor element so that the :has() matches

the anchor element. (e.g. 'target.remove();')



For the removal, StyleEngine have to schedule :has() invalidation

even if the removed element doesn't have any identifier stored in

RuleFeatureSet. But it is not efficient to schedule :has()

invalidation for every element removal.



To avoid unnecessary :has() invalidation, StyleEngine checks whether

its parent has the 'ChildrenAffectedByDirectAdjacentRules' flag set

or not.



Currently, the SelectorChecker sets the flag only when it consumes

a direct adjacent combinator(+). This works most cases but it doesn't

work in this case (condition #2) because the SelectorChecker stops

the :has() argument selector matching before consuming the direct

adjacent combinator. Due to this, the parent of the anchor element

doesn't have the 'ChildrenAffectedByDirectAdjacentRules' flag set

and the StyleEngine doesn't schedule the :has() invalidation for the

removal.



To fix the error, when the SelectorChecker tests a :has() pseudo

class on an anchor element and the :has() is affected by the anchor

element's relationship to a sibling at fixed distance, the

SelectorChecker sets the flag of the parent to indicate that

StyleEngine need to schedule :has() invalidation whenever any child

of the element is removed.



Bug: 1480643

Change-Id: I5ec2e3c1db2773020368415f68bca1503367e669

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4864627

Commit-Queue: Byungwoo Lee

Reviewed-by: Rune Lillesveen

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1198137}

entry.title: Revert "snap-groups: Record snap two windows duration"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 21ab723529a531aa00d927eeebbde38792aaa6d2.



Reason for revert:

This CL breaks tests, e.g.InputDataProviderTest.BadDeviceDoesNotCrash

https://ci.chromium.org/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20ChromiumOS%20MSan%20Tests/38477



Original change's description:

> snap-groups: Record snap two windows duration

>

> This adds metrics that will be used by Snap Groups. We want to record

> the distribution of users snapping a first window then a second window

> on the opposite side within X minutes, where X is very low.

>

> If the first window is unsnapped or closed without a second window

> getting snapped, we will record it as very high, i.e. the max bucket.

>

> Note that this ignores partial ratios, if a user for some reason snaps

> mismatched ratios (e.g. 2/3 left and 1/2 right), it will be recorded.

>

> Test: added

> Fixed: b/299666829

entry.title: Call InProgress when pausing GpuWatchdog.
entry.content:
When GpuWatchdog is paused, in addition to invalidating the GpuWatchdog

timeout task and setting |skip_for_pause_|, call InProgress

(ReportProgress) to ensure the Gpu process will not be terminated.

Also hold |skip_lock_| until crash dump is finished to get a correct

crash signature if the GpuWatchdog kill is triggered before

GpuWatchdog pause.



Bug: 1349437

entry.title: [HitTestOpaqueness] Use view scroll as the scroll state of fixed-position layer
entry.content:
Scroll gesture in a fixed-position layer is special in that though

the layer itself doesn't scroll, the gesture should scroll the

viewport. In pre-HitTestOpaqueness, such scrolls are treated as

unreliable and the main thread will scroll the viewport.

In HitTestOpaqueness, a scroll gesture may be reliable in an

hit-test-opaque fixed-layer, and the scroll state of the layer

is now adjusted to be the viewport scroll so that the compositor

can scroll the viewport, instead of crbug.com/1481779.



Bug: 1413877, 1481779
